nodes.name: Main Hall Junction (Elevator)
Lower Norfair Elevator to Norfair

strats.name: Normal Jumps
strats.note: High jumps for more control when landing.

strats.name: Careful Jumps
strats.note: Take the platforms one at a time.

strats.name: TrickyJumps
strats.note: Take the platforms two at a time by building some run speed for each jump on a one tile runway.

strats.name: Power Bomb Clear
note: Wait for the Dragons to stop attacking and kill them with Power Bombs
It can be faster to control Samus so the Power Bomb does not bounce her, or to avoid Dragon projectiles while Power Bombing them.
Dragons must be on screen to take damage.

strats.name: SpaceJump
strats.note: Use a two tile wide platform to get a good amount of running speed to avoid the room hazards.

strats.name: Normal Jumps
strats.note: High jumps for more control when landing.

strats.name: Careful Jumps
strats.note: Taking the platforms one at a time is not fast enough to avoid the room hazards.

strats.name: Tricky Jumps
strats.note: Take the platforms two at a time by building some run speed for each jump on a one tile runway.

strats.name: Power Bomb Clear
strats.note: Dragons must be on screen to take damage.

to.note: This link exists because of how Samus takes heatdamage while riding the elevator.
This link exists because of how Samus takes heatdamage while riding the elevator.

nodes.name: Fast Pillars Setup Room Top Left Door (to Main Hall)

runways.name: Base Runway - Fast Pillars Setup Room Top Left Door (to Main Hall)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This runway is not usable if the PB blocks are broken.

runways.name: Runway with PB Blocks Intact - Fast Pillars Setup Room Top Left Door (to Main Hall)

strats.name: Fast Pillars Setup Careful PB Periphery Kill
note: The Power Bombs must be placed carefully to hit the Pirate without destroying the PB blocks.
This strat requires heatproof because it's pretty chaotic to execute.
This runway is not usable if the PB blocks are broken, but it also requires the Pirate to be taken out.
Some weapons have been excluded from suitless strats because they were judged to take too much time.

nodes.name: Fast Pillars Setup Room Bottom Left Door (to Fast Rippers)

runways.name: Base Runway - Fast Pillars Setup Room Bottom Left Door (to Fast Rippers)

runways.name: Base Runway - Fast Pillars Setup Room Bottom Right Door (to Pillars)

nodes.name: Fast Pillars Setup Room Top Right Door (to Mickey Mouse)

runways.name: Base Runway - Fast Pillars Setup Room Top Right Door (to Mickey Mouse)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

nodes.name: Fast Pillars Setup Room Junction (Bottom Center)

strats.name: Quick Walljump
strats.note: Walljump from directly above the door to avoid the left wall pirate.

strats.name: Avoid Pirates
note: Shoot the standing pirate with beam shots to prevent it from attacking.
Let the wall pirate climb down a little bit to make passing it easier.

strats.name: Kill Pirates
note: Kill the pirates to free up the full runway for a speedy jump, or to start an IBJ.
If the wall pirate jumps over a Samus who is not crouched, it will climb offscreen on its own.  But may still need to be killed after.

strats.name: Freeze a Pirate
note: Crouch in front of the standing pirate to freely shoot charge shots.
Shoot upon entering the room to interupt the pirate lazer attack.
Stay far enough away from the wall to avoid the wall pirate.
Jumping can be used to distract the wall pirate, in particular when trying to jump to the overhead platform.

strats.name: ShineSpark
strats.note: Spark vertically on room entry.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
note: X-Ray climb up the left wall in order to jump to the center platform.
Quickly kill the pirates using ammo before beginning the X-Ray climb.
Climb to just above the door shell and do a turnaround spinjump to reach the platform.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: HiJumpless
devNote: Destroying the obstacle isn't seen to take extra time for two reasons.
1- It destroys the shot blocks as well which are assumed to be manually destroyed each time since they respawn.
2- Some of the time loss of waiting for the PB is offset by having to setup for the jump up anyway.

strats.name: IBJ
note: The shot block may respawn while bomb jumping and can be cleared by weaving a Power Bomb into the IBJ, or with a bomb placed overhead while bomb jumping.
The Power Bomb can be placed one tile higher than the doors to also clear the Power Bomb Blocks above at the same time.
strats.devNote: Placing a power bomb to break the shot block and the power bomb blocks without dropping the IBJ is the same level of control as canBombAboveIBJ.

nodes.name: Pillar Room Left Door (to Setup Room)

doorEnvironments.note: Acid can rise above the door, but it's possible to have air physics.

runways.name: Base Runway - Pillar Room Left Door (to Setup Room)

nodes.name: Pillar Room Right Door (to Writg)

doorEnvironments.note: Acid can rise above the door, but it's possible to have air physics.

runways.name: Base Runway - Pillar Room Right Door (to Writg)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Lower Norfair Pillar Room with Power Bombs
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Cross the Pillar Room with Power Bombs and minimal damage.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Jump before shinesparking to avoid an early crash.
devNote: There is a heatframe vs shinespark frame tradeoff here.
This excessShinesparkFrame count breaks the small pillar near the door at 2

strats.name: BlueSpace
devNote: This is considered faster than Space Screw because we can safely assume carried momentum from previous rooms.
The heat frame count is conservative and assumes only the speed of a 4-tap.

strats.name: Pillar Room with Power Bombs (Left to Right)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Lower Norfair Pillar Room with Power Bombs
note: Place the PBs next to the pillars in order to only use 2.
Minimize acid by unmorphing high to land back on the jump spot or walljumping before placing the bomb.

strats.name: Pillar Room with Three Power Bombs (Left to Right)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Lower Norfair Pillar Room with Power Bombs
note: The power bombs can be placed pretty far from the next pillar in line.
PB1 - Above the mound of dirt on the ground.  PB2 - On pillar 2.  PB3 - Near pillar 5.

to.devNote: Potentially doable with bombs and enough energy.

strats.name: Screw
note: Break spin to leave some blocks intact in order to avoid damage from Puromis.
Avoiding acid damage at the last jump is tricky but possible.

strats.name: Space Screw
strats.note: Break the half pillar near the entrance, then run back to use the longer runway that this opens up.

strats.name: BlueSpace
devNote: This is considered faster than Space Screw because we can safely assume carried momentum from previous rooms.
The heat frame count is conservative and assumes only the speed of a 4-tap.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Jump before shinesparking to avoid an early crash.

strats.name: Pillar Room with Power Bombs (Right to Left)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Lower Norfair Pillar Room with Power Bombs
note: Place the PBs next to the pillars in order to only use 2.
Avoid acid during the first Power Bomb by walljumping before placing the bomb.
Avoiding acid damage at the last jump is tricky but possible.

strats.name: Pillar Room with Three Power Bombs (Right to Left)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Lower Norfair Pillar Room with Power Bombs
note: The power bombs can be placed far from the next pillar in line.
PB1 - Near the broken pillar.  PB2 - On the 2nd full pillar.  PB3 - On the 4th full pillar.
Wait for the Puromis to avoid damage but wait too long and the acid will cover the door.

to.devNote: Potentially doable with bombs and enough energy.

rooms.name: The Worst Room In The Game

nodes.name: Writg Top Left Door (to Mickey Mouse)

runways.name: Base Runway - Writg Top Left Door (to Mickey Mouse)

nodes.name: Writg Bottom Left Door (to Pillars)

runways.name: Base Runway - Writg Bottom Left Door (to Pillars)

nodes.name: Writg Right Door (to Amphitheatre)

runways.name: Base Runway - Writg Right Door (to Amphitheatre)

nodes.name: Writg Junction (above Climb)
Writg Junction (below Amphitheatre Door)
Writg Junction (Cleared Bottom)
nodes.note: Represents being on the bottom platform with the pirates dead.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: It is possible to get past the pirate without waiting by moving fast enough, or by making it turn around.

strats.name: Writg New Route with HiJump, Speed, and PowerBombs
note: Jump with some run speed to place the power bomb high enough to break the bomb blocks.
During the explosion, jump through the left wall pirate and precisely walljump to reach the upper area.

strats.name: HiJump, Screw, and PowerBomb
note: Use ScrewAttack to remove the left wall pirate and walljump high enough to place a power bomb to destroy the bomb blocks
Then walljump up again to reach the upper region.

strats.name: Jump Assist and PowerBomb
note: Avoid the bottom pirates and jump high enough to break the bomb blocks with a power bomb.
During the explosion, climb the right wall passing through any pirates and use a movement item to reach the top.

strats.name: Writg Frozen Pirate Platforms
note: Freeze the pirates to use as platforms to get up through the bomb blocks. Note that the pirates' hitboxes are larger than they seem.

strats.name: Writg Low Ice Pirate Freeze
note: Deal an exact amount of damage to a wall pirate to freeze it while breaking the bomb blocks with a power bomb without taking damage.
Quickly move to the right side and walljump up to the right height to power bomb out the bomb blocks, double hitting the top wall pirate.
Wait for the full power bomb effect to end and wall jump once on the right wall and hit top pirate with 1 missile and 1 super.
Jump and shoot the top pirate with a charge+ice shot.
Hold a charge and walljump up the left wall and freeze the top pirate when it jumps across.
Use the pirate to jump to the higher area.

strats.name: Writg New Low Ice Pirate Freeze
note: Deal an exact amount of damage to a wall pirate to freeze it while breaking the bomb blocks with a power bomb without taking damage.
Wait briefly on the left side of the center platform, then jump and shoot 4 missiles at the top pirate.
Walljump up the left wall such that the lower pirates are on screen long enough to jump accross to the left.
Place a Bomb on the left wall to hit the top pirate when it jumps over, followed by a power bomb.
Unmorph precisely below the middle pirate so both top pirates will jump back to the right, and begin charging Ice.
Walljump up the left wall with charge held and freeze the top pirate when it jumps over and use it to reach the upper region.

strats.name: Writg Power Bomb Diagonal Bomb Jump
note: Ignore the Yellow Pirates by walljumping up the left side to start a diagonal bomb jump from the wall, including a power bomb to clear the bomb blocks.
Two quick walljumps upon entering the room can position Samus to get the left pirate to jump to the right and jump over the right pirate's lazer attack.
Jump up the left wall and begin bomb jumping starting with a power bomb.
strats.devNote: There is a very similar strat using an HBJ that is a little faster but more precise and overall harder.

strats.name: Writg X-Ray Climb
note: Climb Writg while avoiding wall pirates and Namihe flames.
Immediately climb above the Namihe flames and wait for the wall pirate to jump across into Samus.
Once the pirate starts going up, resume X-Ray climbing.
This is a Two screen X-Ray climb.  Watch for enemies when fixing the camera after the climb.
strats.devNote: Two Namihe hits as leniency.

to.note: This link is for strats that don't require killing the pirates.

strats.name: HeatProof Pirates Kill
strats.note: Being heatproof allows slower kill methods.
strats.devNote: Bombs are still excluded because they take 30 bombs each and that's ridiculous.

strats.name: Supers Pirates Kill
strats.note: The bottom wall pirates can be killed while stacked to save ammo.

strats.name: Missiles Pirates Kill
strats.note: The bottom wall pirates can be killed while stacked to save ammo, but it is not expected.

strats.name: Power Bomb Pirates Kill + Bomb Blocks
note: Jump morph from the center platform to place the first Power Bomb
Place two more on the platform itself to kill the bottom pirates
Use a fourth to break the bomb blocks while also killing the last pirate.
devNote: It's not really possible to hit all enemies with double-PB hits while not taking damage.
Using Power Bomb Periphery is based on a strat that allows killing them and taking out the blocks with 4 PBs.
This calculation ends up taking 5, leaving a spare PB.
The movement item used does not increase heat frames except for IBJ in which case the PB can be used while IBJing.

to.devNote: This is a one-way link because the way back goes 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks can be safely cleared from the door.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Spinjump over the pirate, or clear shot blocks first for more space.

strats.name: Writg HiJump and Only Screw
note: Break the bomb blocks in The Worst Room In The Game with extremely precise walljumps.
Either with a fully delayed max height jump from the wall, or with an instant turnaround after jumping from the lower layer of bomb blocks.

to.note: This is a one-way link because the way back goes 4 -> 2.

doorEnvironments.note: The acid can rise above this door when entering from node 1, but it's possible to have air physics
When entering from node 2, this door is always submerged in acid

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

runways.name: Base Runway - Amphitheatre Right Door (to Red Kihunters)
Runway with no Enemies - Amphitheatre Right Door (to Red Kihunters)
runways.note: This longer runway requires taking out the Space Pirate.

nodes.name: Amphitheatre Junction (Bottom Platform)
Amphitheatre Junction (Center Floating Platforms)

Amphitheatre Junction (Falling Entry)

enemies.note: Technically you can get the drops but you likely won't
Technically you can get the drops but you likely won't

obstacles.name: Room Not Filled With Acid
obstacles.note: Entering trough the left door means there is time before the room fills with acid.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Amphitheatre Reverse Acid Dive
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Dive into the acid and get to the doorway high on the left wall. Note that you can wall jump climb in acid without gravity.

strats.name: Reverse Amphitheatre, Vertical Dive
note: Dive into the acid to the left of the first floating platform to quickly sink to the bottom of the room.
It is possible to jump directly over the pirate at the bottom of the ramp directly to the gap between platforms.
Falling in this way will land between platforms at the bottom of the room unless Samus slows or catches herself on the way down.

strats.name: Reverse Amphitheatre Partial Dive
strats.note: Jump over the pirate and fall straight down to land on an upper-middle floating platform.

strats.name: Reverse Amphitheatre Thread the Needle
note: Jump directly from the top door's ramp, through the pirates, to the far bottom left of the acid filled room.
Begin running from the top of the second slope and jump at the bottom of the third slope, bonking the large stalagtite in the ceiling.
Kill the first pirate with Screw Attack or Charge+Plasma, and pass through the second pirate using a charged plasma shot.
Alternatively, a very low speed shortcharge can run through both pirates.
Enter the acid while aiming down to shrink Samus' hitbox.
This strat works with all combinations of movement items and suits.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Space Jump Acid Climb
strats.note: SpaceJump diagonally towards the door through the acid.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Acid Stutter Shinespark
strats.note: There is just enough runway below the left door to build a shinespark.
strats.devNote: This strat is only used to avoid walljumping.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Speedy Gravity Jump
note: Clear the runway by killing the pirate.
Then Gravity jump after building as much run speed as possible.
devNote: This strat is only used to avoid walljumping.
FIXME: Gravity heat reduction is disabled for part of this strat.

strats.name: Tricky Jump
strats.note: Between the two pirates there is a short runway that can be used to jump to the higher platform.

strats.name: Frozen Pirate
strats.note: Freeze a pirate to use as a platform.  A very strong beam is required to stay out of the acid.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Acid Hop
strats.note: Avoid the pirate while moving through the acid to get closer to the wall.

strats.name: Reverse Amphitheatre SpaceJump
note: Land on the fourth platform from the top and build some speed to spacejump across straight to the door.
The optimal platform can be hit by simpily holding right when entering the acid.
strats.devNote: Includes a little bit extra frame count to drop down two platforms first.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Jump over or kill the final pirate in front of the door.

strats.name: Reverse Amphitheatre Continued Dive
strats.note: Jump off the platform to the left with low horizontal speed and hold left to avoid landing on any pirates.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Acid Wall Climb with Gravity
strats.note: Climb to the top left door while in Acid.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Acid Wall Climb without Gravity
strats.note: It is possible to walljump in acid without Gravity Suit.

strats.name: Amphitheatre Triple SpringBall Jump
note: Acid allows for more time than water to perform Spring Ball jumps.
This gives just barely enough time to fit in three spring ball jumps.
devNote: This strat is only used to avoid walljumping.
1000 leniency frames for retries, and so this does not become the expected strat

strats.name: Amphitheatre Gravity Jump SpringBall Jump
note: Perform a gravity jump followed by a springball jump to reach the left side door.
The gravity jump timing is very precise.
devNote: This strat is only used to avoid walljumping.
FIXME: Gravity heat reduction is disabled for part of this strat.

strats.name: Base
note: Falling into the room while holding right is safe at low horizontal speed.
Pirates can be shot with any weapon to prevent them from firing.

strats.name: Careful Movement
note: Entering with 3 tiles of run speed will let Samus pass under the ceiling and over the bottom center pirate.
Pirates can be shot with any weapon to prevent them from firing.

nodes.name: Red Kihunter Shaft Left Door (to Amphitheatre)

runways.name: Base Runway - Red Kihunter Shaft Left Door (to Amphitheatre)
Runway with Broken Blocks - Red Kihunter Shaft Left Door (to Amphitheatre)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks will respawn if destroyed, but resetting the room is faster than waiting.

runways.name: Runway with Blocks Broken While Entering - Red Kihunter Shaft Left Door (to Amphitheatre)

strats.name: Single Missile Beam Shot
note: Enter the room aiming diagonally down, with a missile set to auto-deselect.
Quickly fire the missile and a beam shot to break both shot blocks and open the full runway.
strats.devNote: Not notable because the runway is easily usable when leaving.

strats.name: Break Blocks With Grapple
strats.note: Enter the room aiming diagonally down and quickly use two grapple shots to break the shot blocks.
strats.devNote: Not notable because the runway is easily usable when leaving.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks will respawn if destroyed, but resetting the room is faster than waiting.

strats.name: Single Missile Beam Shot
note: Enter the room aiming diagonally down, with a missile set to auto-deselect.
Quickly fire the missile and a beam shot to break both shot blocks and open the full runway.
strats.devNote: Not notable because the runway is easily usable when leaving.

strats.note: Enter the room aiming diagonally down and quickly use two grapple shots to break the shot blocks.

nodes.name: Red Kihunter Shaft Junction (Top Middle)
Red Kihunter Shaft Junction (Left Morph Tunnel)
nodes.note: The inner left portion of the morph tunnel, just to the right of the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: Red Kihunter Shaft Junction (At Save Door With Bottom KiHunter Cleared)
nodes.note: Outside the Save Room door with the bottom KiHunter either killed or able to be ignored.

obstacles.name: Pitfall Shot Blocks
obstacles.note: The two vertical shot blocks that can disrupt the runway when broken.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: KiHunter Shaft KiHunter Dodge
note: When coming from the Save room door, the first KiHunter can be baited by jumping into the door then walking left.
The second KiHunter can be jumped past by waiting for the right timing, if it is in the way.
Wait for the top KiHunter to exit the corridor and wait just below so that it will bonk the wall when it attempts to swoop, then jump past.
It is possible the second and third KiHunters group up in the middle which may not be possible to pass without taking damage.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Kihunter Shaft Manipulation from Save Room
note: Manipulate the Three KiHunters to avoid all of them when entering the room from the Save room door.
Stop on a dime on entry for positioning, because it is precise.
Wait 1 second then Morph and roll left, past the swooping kihunter.
Quickly jump to the higher level and run into the left wall.
Wait there for half a second; it helps to jump into the wall.
The 2 KiHunters should be grouped above Samus and out of the way.

strats.name: Slow Kihunter Kill
strats.note: Only Wave can safely clear the Kihunter.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Wait for the KiHunter to drop down on its own.

strats.name: KiHunter Shaft KiHunter Dodge (Bottom)
strats.note: The KiHunter can be baited by jumping into the door then walking left.

strats.name: Kihunter Shaft Manipulation from Save Room (Bottom)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Kihunter Shaft Manipulation from Save Room
note: Manipulate the Three KiHunters to avoid all of them when entering the room from the Save room door.
Stop on a dime on entry for positioning, because it is precise.
Wait 1 second then Morph and roll left, past the swooping kihunter.
Quickly jump to the higher level and run into the left wall.
Wait there for half a second; it helps to jump into the wall.
The 2 KiHunters should be grouped above Samus and out of the way.

strats.name: Fast Descent
strats.note: By breaking the shot blocks and maneuvering through the room effeciently Samus will not have to spend much time waiting on KiHunters.

strats.name: Plasma Run Through Enemies
strats.note: Use Plasma to run through Kihunters instead of waiting.

strats.name: Power Bombs
strats.devNote: FIXME This strat also unlocks node 2. Could add that in later?

strats.name: Bombs
strats.note: Watch for the KiHunter to move right before jumping up to get a safe predicatable swoop.

strats.name: Power Bombs
strats.note: Watch for the KiHunter to move right before jumping up to get a safe predicatable swoop.

strats.name: Red Kihunter Shaft X-Ray Clip
note: Use Xray to stand up. Jump to clip into the floor. Then another jump to clip through the ceiling block.
Watch for the KiHunter to move right before jumping up to get a safe predicatable swoop.
devNote: This requires Power Bombs because it saves neither energy nor ammo using Bombs.
It's slower than Spring Ball mainly because X-Ray scope won't activate during the Power Bomb explosion.

strats.name: Red Kihunter Shaft Bomb Block X-Ray Climb
note: Wait for the bomb blocks to reappear.  Two crouches worth of height are needed before jumping through the rest of the blocks.
Watch for the KiHunter to move right before jumping up to get a safe predicatable swoop.
strats.devNote: This requires Power Bombs because it saves neither energy nor ammo using Bombs.

strats.name: Spring Power Bombs
strats.note: Watch for the KiHunter to move right before jumping up to get a safe predicatable swoop.

strats.name: Slow Kihunter Kill
strats.devNote: Charge, Spazer, Ice on their own is tedious.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Most RNG patterns group the top 2 KiHunters allowing for 0 or 1 hits but sometimes 2 hits are required.

strats.name: Screw Kill
strats.note: Be careful when Walljumping because Screw Attack does not provide protection at that time.

strats.name: KiHunter Shaft KiHunter Dodge (Top)
note: The Middle KiHunter can be jumped past by waiting for the right timing, if it is in the way.
Wait for the top KiHunter to exit the corridor and wait just below so that it will bonk the wall when it attempts to swoop, then jump past.
It is possible the two KiHunters group up in the middle which may not be possible to pass without taking damage.

strats.name: Kihunter Shaft Manipulation from Save Room (Top)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Kihunter Shaft Manipulation from Save Room
note: Manipulate the Three KiHunters to avoid all of them when entering the room from the Save room door.
Stop on a dime on entry for positioning, because it is precise.
Wait 1 second then Morph and roll left, past the swooping kihunter.
Quickly jump to the higher level and run into the left wall.
Wait there for half a second; it helps to jump into the wall.
The 2 KiHunters should be grouped above Samus and out of the way.

nodes.name: Wasteland Left Door (to Metal Pirates)

runways.name: Base Runway - Wasteland Left Door (to Metal Pirates)

nodes.name: Wasteland Top Door (to Red Kihunters)
Power Bomb (Power Bombs of shame)
Wasteland Junction (Central, Enemy Dealt with)
nodes.note: This includes either having killed the Dessgeega or having iframes so you can leave without further damage.

nodes.name: Wasteland Junction (Just Below Central Junction)
nodes.note: This means being just below the central junction, before dealing with the Dessgeega.

nodes.name: Wasteland Junction (Just Left of Central Junction)
nodes.note: This means being just left of the central junction, before dealing with the Dessgeega.

nodes.name: Wasteland Junction (Left of Morph Tunnel)

strats.name: Wasteland X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.
devNote: Ever so slightly shorter than the long climb in Screw Attack Room (1 tile), we'll just put the same value.
Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

to.note: this is a one-way link for the X-Ray climb, because it brings you to the left of the Dessgeega at the top.

strats.name: Base
devNote: It's not possible to reach node 3 without destroying obstacle B.
So no need to elaborate on how it can be destroyed from here and how many heat frames it would take.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.devNote: Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

strats.name: Base
devNote: This expects that the PB gets used a bit before the node is actually reached.
This is why the full wait time isn't included in heat frames.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.devNote: Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

strats.name: Power Bomb
strats.devNote: This expects that the PB is used earlier, avoiding the need to wait for the blast.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.devNote: Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

strats.name: Avoid Hibashi
note: The hibashi hit can be avoided by waiting for the pillar to go up.
That requires the use of one PB and more time than is worth unless heat proof.
strats.devNote: Note that if using PBs, two is required. One each from h_canBombThings, h_canUsePowerBombs.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill

nodes.name: Plowerhouse Farm Junction Free of Holtzes
note: This node indicates being at the farms, where the Holtzes are killed or trapped
Its boundary includes the three Zebbo farms and two middle Holtzes, but not the rightmost or leftmost Holtzes.

farmCycles.name: Crouch over spawn point
farmCycles.note: The farm is too slow to heal faster than the heat damage without some heat reduction.

farmCycles.name: Crouch over spawn point
farmCycles.note: The farm is too slow to heal faster than the heat damage without some heat reduction.

farmCycles.name: Crouch over spawn point
farmCycles.note: The farm is too slow to heal faster than the heat damage without some heat reduction.

strats.name: Avoid the Holtzes
note: Turn back to the left after entering the room then run under the Holtzes.
Damage from a Zebbo from the right farm to gain invulnerability frames, then jump through the last two Holtzes.

strats.name: Strong Beam Avoid Kill
note: Turn back to the left after entering the room then run under the Holtzes.
Avoid the third Holtz, then kill the fourth to clear the middle Zebbo farm.

strats.name: Power Bomb Avoid Kill
note: Place a power bomb near the door, then move right and jump under the Holtzes to the first platform.
Continue placing power bombs while avoiding the Holtzes and avoiding luring the third one to the right.

to.note: Strats with weak beams and no canCarefulJump go 1 -> 2 -> 3, in order to take advantage of the safe spot at 2.

strats.name: Trap the Holtzes
note: One easy way to do this is by waiting for the first Holtz to go under the first platform.
Immediately when it hits the platform, move forward to lure the second Holtz.
When they start going down, jump over them and quickly get to the left side of the first Zebbo farm, trapping 3 Holtzes underneath.

strats.name: Farm to Full
note: Leaving from the farm node assumes killing all the Holtzes and farming to full before exiting.
Gaining energy from the farm requires some sort of heat reduction.

to.devNote: This node is strictly to farm. It is never worth going to this node without being able to farm.

strats.name: Farm to Full
note: Leaving from the farm node assumes killing all the Holtzes and farming to full before exiting.
Gaining energy from the farm requires some sort of heat reduction.

to.devNote: This node is strictly to farm. It is never worth going to this node without being able to farm.

nodes.name: Energy Tank, Ridley
Mickey Mouse Left Door (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

runways.name: Full Runway - Mickey Mouse Left Door (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This runway requires killing the Dessgeegas closest to the door, and taking a Multiviola hit if the Multiviola is alive.
strats.devNote: This strat doesn't actually clear obstacle E, but since we're leaving the room after it doesn't really matter.

runways.name: Small Runway - Micky Mouse Left Door (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

strats.name: Kill Multiviola
strats.note: The Multiviola can be killed by aiming diagonally down when entering the room and shooting a strong enough beam shot (not ice).
strats.devNote: Taking a hit by the Multiviola isn't an option, as it will stop Samus' run and then the Dessgeega will be in the way.

locks.name: Mickey Mouse Grey Lock (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

unlockStrats.name: Kill 5 Multiviolas
devNote: The Multiviolas are far away and can't be killed from here, hence the obstacle requirement.
The only path through this room where killing them and leaving here would be meaningful would have passed through node 4 at some point.
So this strat is only doable by killing the Multiviolas when going 4 -> 6.

unlockStrats.name: Kill Bottom Left
unlockStrats.devNote: The obstacles must already be cleared on the assumption that Samus travels to 7 or 6 and back to unlock the door.

devNote: In reality, any combination of 5 enemies will unlock the door.
But this room is way too complicated to try and track all possibilities.
We went with the two most plausible ones.

nodes.note: Position at the far right end of the bottom hallway

nodes.name: Mickey Mouse Junction (Below Crumble Blocks, Set for Clip)
nodes.note: This is below the crumble blocks, after getting a Multiviola in that chamber.

obstacles.name: Some Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: Represents one set of bomb blocks from obstacle A, with the rest intact. So this obstacle is mutually exclusive with obstacle A.

obstacles.name: Runway Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 3 Dessgeegas closest to the left door

obstacles.name: Boxed-in Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 5 Multiviolas in the Multiviola boxes

obstacles.name: Bottom Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 2 Multiviolas in the bottom hallway

obstacles.name: Far Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 2 Dessgeegas farthest from the left door in the bottom hallway

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Mickey Mouse Viola Ice Clip
note: Guide the bottom right Multiviola from the bottom of Mickey Mouse room all the way to the crumble blocks and use it to ice clip through.
The Multiviola will bounce around the bottom area 4 times before it is able to pass through the shot block.
The door to the left cannot be opened and the respawning shot blocks needs to be removed at the right time.
Avoid damage by freezing the Multiviola, or letting it go off camera while setting up for the next step.
The Ice Clip can jump through the crumble blocks and then break or clip again through the bomb blocks.
Or clip directly into the morph tunnel leading to the Missile location.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: More heat frames than shinespark frames because the shinespark bonk takes some time.

to.note: Direct link for SpeedBooster strats. Other strats should go 1-> 7-> 6.

strats.name: Kill on Entry
note: The multiviola will immediately reach Samus at the door when entering the room.
By entering the room in a jump and aiming down, there is just enough time to shoot the multiviola.
Or by entering the room aiming diagonally down and firing a beam shot.
strats.devNote: You can kill the viola with a super without jumping but that would be a notable strat for being frame precise and its not worth separating that out.

strats.name: Power Bomb
strats.note: Place the power bomb while passing through the shot block gap to save some time.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce onto Crumbles with SpringBall
note: Carry Temporary Blue through the top door of Mickey Mouse to break the left side of the bomb blocks.
Morph while falling through the shot block to bounce on the crumble blocks towards the morph tunnel.
Then unmorph near the wall to fall straight down with temporary blue, if needed.
strats.devNote: You could jump into the room for the initial Temporary Blue and turn around with XRay twice, but this room is heated so that would be costly.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Temporary Blue Crumble Jump without SpringBall
note: Carry Temporary Blue through the top door of Mickey Mouse to break the left side of the bomb blocks.
There is a small frame window where Samus can soft unmorph on the crumble blocks and jump again while retaining temporary blue.
strats.devNote: You could jump into the room for the initial Temporary Blue and turn around with XRay twice, but this room is heated so that would be costly.

strats.name: HiJump
strats.note: Requires one jump off a crumble block

strats.name: HiJump Springball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to just bounce on the crumble blocks.

strats.name: Bootless Spring Ball Escape
note: This is possible by jumping on the crumble blocks into a mid-air spring ball jump, or by avoiding them.
The crumbles can be avoided by starting with either an air ball, a 3 tile high mid-air morph, or a low spring wall.
These are generally safer, as bouncing on the crumble blocks with Spring Ball is trivial.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Crumble Speedjump
note: Spinjump off a crumble block with just a tiny amount of run speed.
That gives just enough height to be able to walljump out.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Crumble Jump IBJ
note: Jump and Mid-air morph off a crumble block to begin the IBJ.
The shot block respawns quickly so it's pretty unforgiving on the IBJ executions.
Conservatively placing bombs for the IBJ will not make it up in time, unless the block is broken while IBJing.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Spring Ball IBJ
note: Shoot the block before starting or in mid-air, then use spring ball to bounce on the crumb blocks and start an IBJ.
The shot block respawns quickly so it's pretty unforgiving on the IBJ executions.
Conservatively placing bombs for the IBJ will not make it up in time, unless the block is broken while IBJing.

strats.name: Power Bomb All the Blocks for Later
Power Bomb the Left Blocks for Later
strats.note: Position the Power Bomb far enough left to only partially clear the bomb blocks.
strats.devNote: This is possible when ice clipping with the multiviola.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
note: Considered killable with Power Beam without taking damage.
Dodge the middle single Multiviola when it jumps up.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Multiviolas. This is one-way because the way back requires setting up the ice clip.

strats.name: Crystal Flash Grapple Clip
strats.note: Menu to Grappling Beam before the crystal flash ends and mash shoot while holding down to be forced on top of the solid block.
devNote: It is considered free to kill the Multiviolas with Power Beam while heatproof, and heatproof is required for the CF clip.
All of the bomb blocks will be destroyed while performing the Crystal Flash.

strats.name: Slow Kill
strats.devNote: Bombs excluded because there's no safe setup.

to.devNote: The Dessgeegas can be assumed to be fought from above, going 4->6->7.

strats.name: Blue Suit Run
strats.note: Taking damage off a Dessgeega at the far right, coming in from the top, allows you to charge a blue suit and get through to the door.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Ice Clip Setup
note: Guide the bottom-right MultiViola to the upper section of the room.
Lure the Dessgeegas away to avoid killing the multiviola.
Remove all enemies and possibly also the row of bomb blocks with a power bomb before attempting to guide the Multiviola.
It will need to bounce each room segment multiple times before lining up to go through each shot block.
Ice can be used to more safely get around the Multiviola as it is bouncing.
However, opening the left side door will change the bounce locations and make the strat no longer possible.
Instead the enemy can be allowed to go off camera and then Samus can prepare to run away as it comes back.
Waiting in the next room segment is a safe way to wait for the Multiviola to bounce and still be able to break shot blocks.
devNote: This is not just getting up there, but also bringing the correct Multiviola with you.
Five hits for leniency because it is hard to avoid damage even while freezing the multiviola.
2.5min strat with plasma

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Some weapons are very slow at killing the Multiviolas and require use of the safe spot in the bottom right Multiviola cage.
strats.devNote: Bombs are excluded because there is no safe setup.

to.devNote: No heatproof or slow kill strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and kill them from there

strats.name: Plasma Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Missiles Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Supers Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Screw Kill
strats.devNote: You can't catch the Multiviolas to kill them with Screw without reaching node 6.

to.devNote: No heatproof or slow kill strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and lure everything there

strats.name: Plasma Hitbox Run-Through
note: Time Plasma shots so that Samus can run through the first two Dessgeegas and build Speedbooster echoes.
Shooting into the floor can give more control over the enemy iframes.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Multiviola Clip (Bomb Block Clip)
note: Ice Clip through the crumble blocks using a Multiviola from the bottom of the room and then Crumble Jump to clip through the bomb blocks.
The ice clip can be setup by standing in a corner and firing forward when the Multiviola hits Samus, if it is moving downwards towards Samus.
The Crumble Jump is done by aiming down (not immediately) after jumping, then changing Samus' hitbox once above the crumble blocks, and jumping again.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Viola Clip (XRay Standup Bomb Block Clip)
note: Freeze the Multiviola on the left side, just below the solid block.
XRay standup and jump to clip up, then jump again to get on top of the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Multiviola Clip (Power Bomb)
note: Ice Clip through the crumble blocks using a Multiviola from the bottom of the room and then Crumble Jump to clip through the bomb blocks.
The ice clip can be setup by standing in a corner and firing forward when the Multiviola hits Samus, if it is moving downwards towards Samus.
Break the bomb blocks with a Power Bomb before bringing the Multiviola up for the clip.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Viola Clip (XRay Standup and Morph)
note: Freeze the Multiviola on the left side, just below the solid block.
XRay standup and jump to clip up, then Morph to be in the morph tunnel.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Multiviola Clip (Screw Attack)
note: Ice Clip through the crumble blocks using a Multiviola from the bottom of the room and then Crumble Jump to clip through the bomb blocks.
The ice clip can be setup by standing in a corner and firing forward when the Multiviola hits Samus, if it is moving downwards towards Samus.
Jump and aim down to break the crumble blocks.
Then quickly spinjump to break the bomb blocks with Screw Attack.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Multiviola Clip (Bombs)
note: Ice Clip through the crumble blocks using a Multiviola from the bottom of the room and then Crumble Jump to clip through the bomb blocks.
The ice clip can be setup by standing in a corner and firing forward when the Multiviola hits Samus, if it is moving downwards towards Samus.
Very quickly jump and morph to place a bomb against the bomb blocks.
Or break the crumble blocks and use SpringBall to jump again to place the bomb.
Then jump again while the Multiviola is still frozen to clip through.

Lower Norfair Fireflea Room Junction (Behind Fune)
Lower Norfair Fireflea Room Junction (Claw)

enemies.groupName: Lower Norfair Fireflea Room Bottom Fune
Lower Norfair Fireflea Room Top Funes

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: LN Firefleas Ice Bridge
note: Avoid killing the Firefleas and instead freeze them as a way accross the spikes.
It helps to freeze them low, closer to the spikes.

strats.name: Kill One Fune
strats.note: Clear one of the paired Fune heads with a Super Missile or Power Bomb.  Run from or jump over the Boulders.

strats.name: Kill Many Enemies
note: Boulders can be killed by Super Missiles or by Pseudo Screwing.
Funes are weak to Super Missiles and Power Bombs.

strats.name: Ice
strats.note: Freeze the Fune heads and run from the Boulders.

strats.name: Screw Attack
strats.note: The 2 Funes plus Boulder can be tricky.  Try to activate the Boulder before jumping up to that platform.

strats.name: Spring Ball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: Bombs
strats.note: Bomb diagonally to get over the Fune.  Or land on a fireball to boost up.

strats.name: LN Fireflea Room Damage Boost Over the Fune
note: A well-done mid-air morph can get up and over the Fune using the boost from a projectile hit. It's best to hit the flame as soon as it spawns.
It's a 2.5 tile high mid air morph. It can be performed similar to how a 2 or 3 tile high morph is performed.
strats.devNote: Two Leniency hits.

strats.name: LN Fireflea Room Morph Over the Fune
note: A paricularly precise mid-air morph can get up and over the Fune without damage.
Stand a half tile away from the Fune when jump morphing for a higher ceiling.
It's a 2.5 tile high mid air morph. It can be performed similar to how a 2 or 3 tile high morph is performed.

strats.name: LN Firefleas Top to Bottom Itemless Damageless
note: An extremely precise spinjump or walljump can avoid the top Boulder.
The spinjump requires dash state and to jump right away.
Aiming down shortly after helps by reducing Samus' hitbox.

strats.name: Morph
note: Roll under the top Fune fireball then roll off the edge to avoid the first Boulder.
Kill a Fune or use the Boulder for IFrames to get through the tricky section.
It is also possible to Kago the Fune to save health compared to taking a Boulder hit.

strats.name: LN Fireflea Ice Bridge (Right to Left)
note: Avoid killing the Firefleas and instead freeze them as a way accross the spikes.
It helps to freeze them low, closer to the spikes.

strats.name: LN Fireflea Ice Bridge (Left to Right)
note: Avoid killing the Firefleas and instead freeze them as a way accross the spikes.
It helps to freeze them low, closer to the spikes.

strats.name: Frozen Fireflea
strats.note: Be careful not to touch the firefleas or they will die.

strats.name: Norfair Fireflea Bug Boost Escape
note: Set up to Damage boost off the highest Fireflea at the apex of your jump, next to the Ridley claw.
It's precise, and can only be attempted once.
Morphing can make the boost a little easier.
strats.devNote: This strat is just to skip a walljump.

strats.name: Lower Norfair Fireflea IBJ
strats.note: IBJ on the right side of the platform.

strats.name: Fireflea Walljump Damage Boost
strats.note: This can only be attempted once.

strats.name: Spring Ball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to get up and over the Fune.  Jump when slightly away from the Fune.

strats.name: Bombs
strats.note: Use a Bomb to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: R Jump Over the Fune
strats.devNote: There is a way to walljump morph over the Fune, but a pause buffer is magnitudes easier.

strats.name: Reverse Spring Ball Maze Crystal Flash Clip
strats.note: Perform the crystal flash all the way against the left wall of the accessible tunnel, then jump through the ceiling.
strats.devNote: Does not include heatFrames while refilling health.

strats.name: Kill While Running
strats.note: Kill the Alcoon without stopping.

strats.name: Quick Kill
strats.note: Jump over the Alcoon's fireball and kill it and run through.
strats.devNote: Beams that take more than two shots are generally not quick enough to justify.

strats.name: Avoid
strats.note: Run under the Alcoon as it spawns
strats.devNote: canDodgeWhileShooting represents the knowledge of how this Alcoon spawns and that you can run under it.

strats.name: Kill Without Stopping
strats.note: Kill the Alcoon in one hit as it spawns.

strats.name: Stop and Kill
strats.note: Let the Alcoon spawn and then defeat it.

strats.name: LN Spring Ball Maze Air Speedball
strats.note: Jump and Morph with a speedball to enter the morph tunnel and then use SpringBall to break the bomb blocks.

to.devNote: This one-way link represents only the Hotarubi Special. Anything else should go 6-> 4-> 5.

strats.name: Tricky Dash Jump
strats.note: Jump from the bottom of the slope with about 6 tiles of run speed.

strats.name: Kill While Running
strats.note: Kill the Alcoon without stopping.

strats.name: Tricky Dash Jump
strats.note: Jump from the bottom of the slope with about 6 tiles of run speed.

Power Bomb (lower Norfair above fire flea room)

strats.name: Base
note: Just reaching the node would be doable in 50 frames.
We have 100 here because getting into the door takes a bit more time than that.

nodes.name: Three Musketeers Left Door (to Single Chamber)

runways.name: Base Runway - Three Musketeers Left Door (to Single Chamber)
Runway with Blocks Intact - Three Musketeers Left Door (to Single Chamber)
runways.note: This longer runway is not usable if the shot blocks are destroyed.

nodes.name: Three Musketeers Right Door (to Spring Ball Maze)

runways.name: Base Runway - Three Musketeers Right Door (to Spring Ball Maze)

nodes.name: Missile (lower Norfair near Wave Beam)
Three Musketeers Central Junction

obstacles.name: Three Musketeers
devNote: The shot blocks are treated as broken when this obstacle is cleared.
For that reason the Musketeers are treated as cleared when travelling to the top door even if they may not be dead.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Wait for the first KiHunter to pass and then run through the remaining two.

strats.name: Dodge the Three Musketeers Going Down
note: Wait for the top one to pass by.
Jump down when the lower two are by the left wall and jump over them when they swoop.

strats.name: Screw Kill
strats.note: By moving quickly, the KiHunters will be in favourable positions.  Otherwise wait until it is safe to continue.

strats.name: Full Combo Kill
note: Shooting straight down can hit the KiHunter below.
Jumping before shooting down can even double hit, instantly killing them.

strats.name: Chargeless Wave Plasma Kill
strats.note: The top KiHunter can be ignored.

strats.name: Plasma Kill
strats.note: Jump to the previous level when the enemy gets close, or fight entirely from safety.

strats.name: Supers Kill
note: Jump to the previous level when the enemy gets close, or fight entirely from safety.
Two supers can hit per cycle when shooting from above.
strats.devNote: Without two supers per cycle, this requires heatproof.

strats.name: Ice Wave Spazer Kill
strats.note: Shooting rapidly at an angle is faster than jumping and firing down.

strats.name: HiJump Speed Mockball
note: Run into the acid to quickly jump over the first pillar.
Build speed and jump over the second pillar to mockball through the tunnel without taking much acid damage.

strats.name: SpaceJump Weave
strats.note: Enter the room while spacejumping and weave between the pillars.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: There's technically a bomb block to break, but it's impossible to reach this node without destroying it beforehand.

strats.name: Kihunters Already Dead
strats.devNote: SpringBallBombJump uses 3 power bombs total.

strats.name: Hitbox the Kihunters
note: Wait for the Kihunters to move away from where Samus will jump up.
This may mean Hitboxing through the middle KiHunter multiple times.

strats.name: Dodge the 3 Musketeers Going Up
note: Read the movements of the Kihunters and jump over or roll under them as appropriate.
Changing platforms is the hardest part:
jumping extra high and morphing works sometimes, other times jump short and roll under.

strats.name: Partial Kihunter Dodge
strats.note: Jump over the first Kihunter and attempt to either use IFrames to pass through the top Kihunter, or dodge it if possible.

strats.name: Ice Wave Plasma Kill
note: Firing upwards has a good chance of hitting multiple Kihunters.
And charge shot double hits will instantly kill a Kihunter.

strats.name: Plasma Kill
strats.note: Fire up from below and try not to jump too high as that will put the camera in a bad position.
strats.devNote: FIXME IBJ strats could be added with heat frames.

strats.name: Supers Kill
strats.note: Fire up from below and try not to jump too high as that will put the camera in a bad position.

strats.name: Ice Wave Spazer Kill
strats.note: Fire up from below and try not to jump too high as that will out the camera in a bad position.
strats.devNote: FIXME IBJ strats could be added with heat frames.

strats.name: Slow HeatProof Kill
note: Shoot them from below.
It is possible for the KiHunters to fall through the gaps in the side, but is unlikely.
Jumping may lower the camera position making it harder to shoot the KiHunters.
But once it is lowered, jump to make them active and vulnerable to damage.
strats.devNote: SpringBallBombJump uses 3 powerbombs total.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Wait for the acid to go down before entering the Morph tunnel, and again once reaching the other side.

strats.name: Staggered Wall Jump
strats.note: Walljump in place while the acid goes away.

nodes.name: Red Kihunter Shaft Save Room Door (to Red Kihunters)

runways.name: Base Runway - Red Kihunter Shaft Save Room Door (to Red Kihunters)

nodes.name: Red Kihunters Save Station
